definition: to pull/to tear/(of cloth, thread etc) to buy/to chat/to gossip/(coll.) (Tw) ridiculous/hokey

sentences.english: They lie and cheat and send young Americans to their death solely for their own profit.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲了自己的利益扯謊作弊，讓美國年輕人去送死。

sentences.english: All advertising tells lies, but there are little lies and there are big lies.
sentences.chinese: 所有廣告都在扯謊，只不過是小謊和大謊的區別。

sentences.english: A liar is not considered when he speaks the truth.
sentences.chinese: 扯謊者縱使講實話也沒人相信。

sentences.english: She threw the lie in his face.
A boaster and a liar are cousins- german.
sentences.chinese: 吹法螺與扯謊本是同宗。

sentences.english: You should not tell a lie and say you have five years of experience when you really have two.
sentences.chinese: 如果你惟有兩年的經驗，你就不應該扯謊說有五年。
我們扯謊是爲了避免衝突。

sentences.english: Xiao dream points out that lie crescent.
Research shows we lie less to people that we are close to.
sentences.chinese: 研究剖明我們對自己對照親密的人扯謊少一些。

sentences.english: For thy records, and what we see doth lie.
sentences.chinese: 因爲你的記載和我所見都扯謊。

sentences.english: B boaster and a liar are cousins-german.
sentences.chinese: 吹法螺與扯謊本是同宗。
